intro: Byttneria, commonly known as the "wild silk tree," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, many of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their alternate, simple leaves and showy, usually yellow or orange flowers. Byttneria species are known for their fibrous bark, which has been used traditionally for making ropes and textiles. Some species also produce fruits that are edible or have medicinal properties.
